Body.Content:
The August 2025 security update is now available for all supported versions of Windows. We recommend that you install these updates promptly. For more information about the contents of this update, see the release notes, which are easily accessible from the Windows 11 and Windows 10 update history pages. To learn more about the different types of monthly quality updates, see Windows monthly updates explained.
  
Highlights for the Windows 11, version 24H2 update: 
  • This security update includes improvements that were a part of update KB5062660 (released July 22, 2025).
  • This update makes quality improvements to the servicing stack, which is the component that installs Windows updates.
  • This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
  • This update addresses an issue that caused long delays during sign-in on new devices.

Short on time? Watch our Windows 11 release notes video for this month's tips.

For instructions on how to install this update, see the KB for your operating system listed below: 
  • Windows 11, version 24H2: KB5063878
  • Windows 11, versions 23H2 and 22H2: KB5063875 
  • Windows 11 Enterprise LTSC 2024: Hotpatch KB5064010
  • Windows 10, versions 22H2 and 21H2: KB5063709
  • Windows 10 Enterprise LTSC 2019 and Windows Server 2019: KB5063877
  • Windows 10 LTSB 2016 and Windows Server 2016: KB5063871
  • Windows 10 LTSB 2015: KB5063889
  • Windows Server 2025: KB5063878
  • Windows Server 2025 Datacenter: Azure Edition: Hotpatch KB5064010
  • Windows Server 2022: KB5063880
  • Windows Server 2022 Datacenter: Azure Edition: Hotpatch KB5063812
  • Windows Server 2012 R2: Monthly Rollup: KB5063950
  • Windows Server 2012: Monthly Rollup: KB5063906
  • Windows Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 1: Monthly Rollup: KB5063947 / Security Only: KB5063927
  • Windows Server 2008 SP2: Monthly Rollup: KB5063888 / Security Only: KB5063948

Title: The August 2025 Windows security update is now available
